hook.text: No substance enters the body, yet gambling can hijack the brain just like heroin.

buildup.text: Near-misses trigger dopamine surges that keep players chasing the next win.

discovery.text: Brain scans of pathological gamblers look remarkably similar to drug addicts.

twist.text: Gambling disorder is the only behavioral addiction in the DSM-5.

climax.text: Online gambling has made it accessible 24/7, accelerating addiction rates.

punchline.text: You don't need a substance to lose everything.

quiz.question: Why do near-misses fuel gambling addiction?
options: They trigger dopamine surges similar to actual wins
